intro: Haplopappus greenei subsp. mollis, commonly known as the softleaf haplopappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a single head. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical structure reflects its evolutionary adaptation to survive in harsh, semi-desert conditions.
